intro: Amphiasma merenskyanum, commonly known as the Cape fumitory, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
